data.title: Decent southern cooking
data.text:
The food was well prepared. Anything fried was just fantastic. The catfish, chicken, onion rings, and okra each had a different fry coating and it worked well. Chicken and waffles were great even with this homemade maple-gravy. 

The location is a good size and homely if not a little basic. Small pieces of local art cover the walls. The service was decent but a bit too finicky. 

I would come again for the chicken and waffles!

data.title: First visit to this restaurant
data.text: My wife and I were in the Memphis area to attend a concert, and wanted to find a restaurant in Bartlett. I had looked on TripAdvisor, and found Sweetpea's. Although not fancy, the friendly staff and excellent food will make you forget your surroundings quickly. Our waitress was excellent, and the food was absolutely delicious! I recommend the county fried steak! The desserts are homemade, and the strawberry cake we shared was to die for. If you are ever in the Bartlett area, find this restaurant and treat yourself to some awesome southern cooking.

data.title: Fantastic home cooking!
data.text:
Craving some southern home cooking without the hassle of cooking at home, we tried Sweetpea's. Great selection of southern favorites that are delicious! Portions are perfect and very filling! The night we went they had live entertainment with an Elvis impersonator who serenaded the ladies who were there enjoying his music. Nice atmosphere with very friendly staff! Definitely our go to from now on when we are craving some good southern cooking! 

My boyfriend was very pleased with the fried catfish! The hamburger steak I had was great! So many tasty sides to chose from, we were very pleased with our selections! great value for the amount of food you get and the quality of food!

data.title: Home Cooking at its Best!
data.text: Every items on the menu is prepared to perfection.  The best onion rings every had!  The service is top notch.  Great attention to detail even when the place is full.  The gospel group once a month is a real treat.  They sing many of the old songs that we all love.  The vegetables are cooked just the way grandma fixed them.

data.title: FRIED GREEN TOMATOES!! AWESOME!
data.text:
Almost like home if the chairs were a bit more comfortable. 
Never had anything here but excellent food....only thing missing from this Menu is Blackberry Cobbler!
Wait Staff is always smiling, friendly and efficient.  Daily specials keep the menu from becoming boring. 
Do not miss the Fried Catfish and excellent Hush Puppies.
Highly recommend this great place to eat!

data.title: Excellent southern cooking
data.text:
When you see purple hulled peas,fried chicken livers, and fried bologna sandwich on the menu there is no doubt you are in a true southern cooking restaurant. 

Our first stop there was just for desserts, which were so good we came back the next day for lunch. If possible, the meals were even better than the desserts. 

My wife is a chicken pot pie aficionado and this was the best she had ever had. Every thing all five of us had was superb. I could go on and on but I think you get the idea that we really enjoyed the food. 

The service also deserves mention. Our waitresses on both trips were excellent and very friendly. 

Highly recommended.

data.title: Friday Date Night
data.text: Went to Sweetpea's for a home-cooked style meal.  I had grilled chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries.  My wife had Chef's salad.  Both were prepared very nicely.  Waitresses were prompt and attentive.  We had a pleasant surprise - live entertainment.  Tim Rowland - Voices of the Legends - singing impersonator was there and did a great job with, of course, Elvis, and Roy Orbison, Johnny Cash, and many more.  Glad we went.  This is normally a family friendly, local's favorite for home cooked type meals.

data.title: Sunday Lunch
data.text: Can't beat great food reasonably priced!  I had the stuffed bell peppers with greens and purple hull peas and my wife had the country fried steak.  Both meals were great and will defintley go back.  It's to hard to find real home cooking anymore.

data.title: Lots of food
data.text: Very good good and generous portions. The fried pickles are delish!!!  I got the vegetable plate but wanted to try several other things. I will be back!!

data.title: "Sweet" Experience!
data.text:
What can you say about another "home style" restaurant?  Standard tasteless Entrees, unseasoned vegetables,potatoes from a box, watered down tea?

NOT if you are reviewing Sweetpea's Table!  For them you can say PLENTY. 
Look them up in your dictionary under Home Cookin' or read on........

Entrée portions are large and each day features new items to choose from along with numerous side items.  All your basic country style veggies (perfectly seasoned) are covered plus a lot more.  We've sampled several menu items and have not been disappointed.

Do not miss the Fried Green Tomatoes or the Catfish Filets or the Country Fried Steak or the perfectly sweetened Ice Tea. Can you tell we were impressed?
So get your "South" on, drive down old Highway 64 aka Stage Road and take a seat.  I promise you will leave full AND happy.

Oops, nearly forgot.....there is another location in Olive Branch, MS!

data.title: Wonderful lunch for "meat and three"
data.text: Homey, casual southern cooking in old part of Bartlett that tastes like home cooking. Fried chicken, okra, black eye peas and catfish are good. Everything else including desserts look just as good so will go back to try other items on the menu soon! If going at lunch during the week get there befor 11:30 to avoid the rush.

data.title: Very cool
data.text: Very nice. Food was really good and the live entertainer, Tim Rowland was good. A little loud but a fun place to eat.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Food is great.  Entertainer is really loud.  Servers can't hear customers and was almost impossible to have a conversation with family.  The bad news is that he keeps increasing the volume.

data.title: Great country cookin!
data.text: One of my semi regular lunch stops. Reminds me of mamaws cooking haha. I think I've tried just about everything, but my favorites are definitely the fried pork chop and the meatloaf. The cornbread is really good to as well as the desserts. They do carry out as well which is great.

data.title: Home cooking for sure!
data.text: Situated in a little semi shopping, office space area in the city of Bartlett, TN. We drove past it, but notice a marquee at a driveway. Even when we got in the parking lot we had to scout around a little to find the door. Despite the challenge of finding this place, the food won us over. I had the country fried steak covered in white gravy, green beans and sweet potato casserole. The meat was lightly battered, the green beans were heavenly seasoned and the sweet potato casserole was tasty. My husband had the catfish. He said the filets were light tasting. Also had the green beans, but opted for French fries with his meal. If you're looking for home cooking, you can find it at Sweetpea's.

data.title: Good home-cooking
data.text: I have tried several different entrees and found all to be good. Food is served hot. Service is speedy and attentive.

data.title: Southern Home Cooking
data.text: Sweetpea’s provide home cook meals at very reasonable prices.  This is my “go to” place when I want a hot meal but don’t want the hassle of cooking it.  Mrs. Johnette’s southern hospitality is refreshing and she greets her customers by name.  Mrs. Dee’s (no longer works there) sweet potato pie was the best in Bartlett.  I love the fried pickles, grilled chicken sandwich as well as the seafood.  Connie is usually my waitress and provides superior customer service every time I visit.  The “mature” customers really enjoy the live entertainment (Elvis).  This is a great neighborhood restaurant.

data.title: Teriffic home style cooking !
data.text: I have visited this restaurant a few times this year. Both times , everything I have tried on the menu is great. My girl & I have had the fried green tomatoes both times, they are excellent ! The country fried steak is cooked perfectly. All the veggies i tried are cooked well but not cooked until they are mush. The service provided on both visits was super, even though on one trip the place was packed .They have music on Saturday night by an Elvis Impersonator, who also does a variety of music. I will surely return regularly to try more of that awesome food ! This is some of the best home style cooked food in the Memphis area.

data.title: Home cookin
data.text: This Virginia girl loved the sweet potato casserole. The fried chicken filet was juicy and the fried apple pie was delish.

data.title: Great "home town"-style restaurant!
data.text: Just recently discovered this great down-home style restaurant!  So far we've twice tried their daily lunch specials and they were delicious!  The Country Fried Steak is very good; the Fried Chicken Livers are great.  Their cornbread is to-die-for:  true southern, from white corn meal, moist and dense and not sweet!!  Their Cole Slaw is very much to my liking--not too sweet and not too sour.  They have a very large selection of sides and a very friendly staff.  Ask for a senior discount, or a very generous discount for in-uniform military or law enforcement.
